intro: Zehneria scabra subsp. scabra, commonly known as the rough zehneria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
